metadata.title: CVE-2022-28615 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Apache HTTP Server 2.4.53 and earlier may crash or disclose information dueto a read beyond bounds in ap_strcmp_match() when provided with anextremely large input buffer. While no code distributed with the server canbe coerced into such a call, third-party modules or lua scripts that useap_strcmp_match() may hypothetically be affected.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28615` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.24').
